org.apache.ambari.server.stack

Class HostsType

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.stack.HostsType

  • public class HostsType
extends Object
    Wrapper around a collection of hosts for components. Some components also have master/secondary designators.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  HostsType.HighAvailabilityHosts
      A master and secondary host(s).

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      List<ServiceComponentHost> unhealthy
      Unhealthy hosts are those which are explicitly put into maintenance mode.

    • Field Detail

      • unhealthy

        public List<ServiceComponentHost> unhealthy
        Unhealthy hosts are those which are explicitly put into maintenance mode. If there is a host which is not heartbeating (or is generally unhealthy) but not in maintenance mode, then the prerequisite upgrade checks will let the administrator know that it must be put into maintenance mode before an upgrade can begin.

    • Method Detail

      • hasMasters

        public boolean hasMasters()
        Returns:
        true if master components list is not empty

      • getHighAvailabilityHosts

        public List<HostsType.HighAvailabilityHosts> getHighAvailabilityHosts()

      • arrangeHostSecondariesFirst

        public void arrangeHostSecondariesFirst()
        Order the hosts so that for each HA host the secondaries come first. For example: [sec1, sec2, master1, sec3, sec4, master2]

      • hasMastersAndSecondaries

        public boolean hasMastersAndSecondaries()
        Returns:
        true if both master and secondary components lists are not empty
